ThingDef.label: anima carrier leg
ThingDef.description: This leg shares a psychic bond with a special kind of dryad, granting supernatural strenght. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima clawer arm
ThingDef.description: An anima clawer arm, consisting of multiple very sharp sticks that mimic clawer dryads during combat. \nIts sharp points are covered with tiny needles filled with a powerful toxin, capable of paralyzing foes with pain. \nEnhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima gauranlen arm
ThingDef.description: An arm that mimitizes a gauranlen connection, improving the user's psychic bond with the planet's flora. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima horn
ThingDef.description: An intricately carved horn, capable of intense psychic focus. Legend say of an ancient civilization whose people grew beautiful horns like this one, but disappeared after meeting their machine god.

ThingDef.label: anima nose
ThingDef.description: A nose made of sensitive anima grass, capable of sensing a wide range of pheromones, which helps in communicating with the local fauna. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima jaw
ThingDef.description: A jaw made of sturdy hardwood, its sap contains natural healing properties. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima ear
ThingDef.description: An ear made of delicate anima grass roots, releases pheromones that confuses animals' senses, making the owner harder to find. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: psychic dryad
ThingDef.description: A special kind of dryad that can sense and understand human emotions, very powerful in the right hands. In combat, however, being able to unconsciously read enemies' aggression can cause hesitation. (Reduces melee dodge chance if enabled in the mod settings)

ThingDef.label: mind dryad
ThingDef.description: A fully grown dryad, able to fill in while the brain is resting. \nUsed to a tranquil existance, can aid in maintaining focus during meditation, but does not like to be under pressure. \nWhile the mind dryad can adapt very well to the natural brain, any consciousness affecting drugs or implants will be considered threats and be nullified by it(caps consciousness at 130% if enabled in the mod settings).

ThingDef.label: anima barkskin
ThingDef.description: A thick bark-like hide covering the entire body. Helps at releasing neural heat, but is susceptible to fire.

ThingDef.label: anima liver
ThingDef.description: Roots spreading through the body, this one goes into the liver. Boosts blood circulation and coagulation while strenghtening the immune system. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima kidney
ThingDef.description: Roots spreading through the body, this one goes into the kidneys. Boosts natural healing and enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima polux lung
ThingDef.description: Roots spreading through the body, this one goes into the lungs. Allows the owner to meditate better and massively strenghtens neural heat dissipation.

ThingDef.label: anima eye
ThingDef.description: A colorful, crystal-like sap in the form of an eye, it's quite pretty and... hypnotizing. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima stomach
ThingDef.description: A wooden pulsating mass, with anima sap inside it, it blesses everything the person eats. Enhances psychic meditation.

ThingDef.label: anima spine
ThingDef.description: An anima trunk holding the body together, sending roots all over the body, strengthening it. The roots are less sensitive to pain.

ThingDef.label: anima heart
ThingDef.description: A heart made out of multiple dryads, which helps the user's blood circulation and closes wounds quickier. Expands and strenghtens the owner's psychic abilities.

ThingDef.label: unfinished anima bodypart
ThingDef.description: An unfinished anima bodypart.

ThingDef.label: Gorilla Arm
ThingDef.description: A Gorilla Arm. Gorilla Arms, like most late generation cyberware, feature real-time 1:1 synaptic junctions that operate as fast as the user can think. Rather than mechanical actuators, their strength now comes from synthetic muscles made of electric-field activated shape-memory alloys that easily fit within the normal profile of your arm. Apply a layer of Realskinn on top, and no one needs to know you can rip open closed doors like they are made out of paper; though if you want, bright colors and trademark patterns can advertise what you're packing.

ThingDef.label: Mantis Blade
ThingDef.description: A Mantis Blade. Arm blades designed with lethality and concealment in mind. As effective as they are flashy.

ThingDef.label: Higurashi 20-13 Mantis Blade
ThingDef.description: A Higurashi 20-13 Mantis Blade. An older iteration of the Mantis Blade arm cyberware, they are considered to be of very high quality but suffer from a dangerous flaw - poor interface with neural processors and the prefrontal cortex, which results in users frequently developing cyberpsychosis.

ThingDef.label: Projectile Launch System
ThingDef.description: A Projectile Launch System. A missile launcher in the palm of your hand (more or less literally).

ThingDef.label: biomonitor
ThingDef.description: A biomonitor. Reads user's vitals and automatically dispenses remedies to maintain homeostasis. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: microrotors
ThingDef.description: A set of microrotors. Improves melee attack speed. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: clutch padding
ThingDef.description: A clutch padding implant. Increases rate of ranged attacks. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: blood pump
ThingDef.description: A blood pump. Provides a secondary source of blood to keep the user alive and accelerates oxygen supply to the body's cells. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Kiroshi "Stalker" optics
ThingDef.description: A Kiroshi "Stalker" eye. High-quality cyberoptic implant with advanced multi-spectral scanning and targeting modes, and specialized datalink processors for ranged combat. This allows the user to accurately approximate target positions in complete darkness or even behind cover.

ThingDef.label: Kiroshi "Doomsayer" optics
ThingDef.description: A Kiroshi "Doomsayer" eye. High-quality cyberoptic implant with advanced wide-angle scanning and threat detection modes, and specialized datalink processors for melee combat. This allows the user to respond swiftly to close-range threats, even in complete darkness.

ThingDef.label: Kiroshi "The Oracle" optics
ThingDef.description: A Kiroshi "The Oracle" eye. Iconic cyberoptic implant with advanced wide-angle multi-spectral scanning, targeting and threat detection modes and dual-mode datalink processors for ranged and melee combat. This allows the user to accurately approximate target positions in complete darkness or even behind cover, and also respond swiftly to close-range threats.

ThingDef.label: memory boost
ThingDef.description: A memory boost implant. An implant that increases the brain's capacity to store and process information. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Ex-Disk
ThingDef.description: An Ex-Disk. A module that optimizes the sync between brain and cyberware. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Kerenzikov Boost System
ThingDef.description: A Kerenzikov Boost System. Improves Kerenzikov by enhancing the user's speed and reflexes. *Note: This is only intended to be used alongside an existing Kerenzikov implant, but I do not know how to force it as a prerequisite implant. Please pretend you need a Kerenzikov for this.

ThingDef.label: shock absorbers
ThingDef.description: A pair of shock absorbers. These reduce recoil and improve weapon handling. They also make the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: ballistic coprocessor
ThingDef.description: A ballistic coprocessor. Increases accuracy and acquisition speed.

ThingDef.label: Handle Wrap implant
ThingDef.description: A Handle Wrap implant. Increases melee hit and crit chance.

ThingDef.label: Immovable Force
ThingDef.description: An Immovable Force. Improved Iconic variant of the shock absorbers. These decrease recoil massively, to the point of allowing the user to fire significantly faster than normal. They also make the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: optical camo
ThingDef.description: An optical camo system. Makes the user impossible to locate in visible spectrum light. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: subdermal armor
ThingDef.description: A layer of subdermal armor. Simple, but effective. Can be installed on multiple body parts.

ThingDef.label: Proxishield
ThingDef.description: A Proxishield. Increases defense against melee threats. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Pain Editor
ThingDef.description: A Pain Editor. Increases armor, reduces damage taken. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Chitin
ThingDef.description: A Chitin subdermal protection system. Thick plates of armor laid under the skin provide solid protection against most threats. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: fortified ankles
ThingDef.description: A pair of fortified ankles. Ankle joints reinforced with plastic fibers and nanogel-filled joint capsules, allowing the user to channel more power from their legs and perform charged jumps.

ThingDef.label: Leeroy Ligament System
ThingDef.description: A Leeroy Ligament System. Increases movement speed.

ThingDef.label: Jenkins' Tendons
ThingDef.description: A Jenkins' Tendons implant. Increases movement speed.

ThingDef.label: Kerenzikov
ThingDef.description: A Kerenzikov. Passively increases perception during critical moments. Results vary depending on the circumstances and are difficult to quantify. On average, the user gains roughly 12% more time to process and act. The increased processing does take a small toll on the user, forcing them to rest slightly more often. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Neofiber
ThingDef.description: A Neofiber synthetic muscle replacement. Adaptive hardening capability allows the user to cushion impacts and reduce penetration from projectiles that may otherwise bypass the outer armor layers. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Stabber
ThingDef.description: A Stabber implant. Improved reflex suite improves user's performance in melee combat. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: visual cortex support system
ThingDef.description: A visual cortex support system. Provides a secondary visual processing center, allowing the user to more quickly spot targets and weak points. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: chrome compressor
ThingDef.description: A chrome compressor. Lowers risk of psychosis at the cost of taking up the OS slot, and is incompatible with sandevistan, berserk and cyberdeck implants. Like all OS cyberware, this makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs.

ThingDef.label: bionic joints
ThingDef.description: A bionic joint system. Increases armor and carrying capacity.

ThingDef.label: titanium bones
ThingDef.description: A titanium skeleton. Increases armor. Simple, but effective. Can be installed on multiple body parts.

ThingDef.label: dense marrow
ThingDef.description: A dense marrow implant. Increases melee damage at the cost of attack speed. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Rara Avis
ThingDef.description: A Rara Avis skeletal armor mounting system. Provides an improved foundation for new and existing armor implants, dramatically boosting their effectiveness. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: the Relic 3.0
ThingDef.description: The Relic 3.0. Contains an infusion of nanites injected below the back of the skull. Developed from knowledge of the Relic 2.0 after an experimental case study involving the person who stole and activated it. Instead of cannibalizing its host's brain like its predecessor, the nanites within this unit surround and interface with the brain and allow the host to better tolerate an increased amount of cyberware. The onboard AI engram has also been tailored specifically towards providing therapeutic guidance and moral support for the host without interfering with daily activities, drastically suppressing psychotic tendencies. This comes at the cost of making the host almost totally psychically deaf as the nanites also act as a Faraday cage around the brain, shielding it from direct electromagnetic signals. The Relic itself remains vulnerable to EMP attacks which will cause it to malfunction and disrupt the neural pathways, causing pain and impairing motor function. Once activated, the Relic cannot be removed.

ThingDef.label: Arasaka Shadow Mk.5 cyberdeck
ThingDef.description: An Arasaka Shadow cyberdeck. Specialized for stealth operations, able to turn enemies against each other or knock them flat out. Installed quickhacks: Short Circuit, Bait, Memory Wipe (2 charges), Sonic Shock, Cyberpsychosis (2 charges), System Collapse This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Militech Paraline cyberdeck
ThingDef.description: A Militech Paraline cyberdeck. A military-grade deck focused on suppression and force escalation. Excels at disabling and destabilizing high-priority targets. Installed quickhacks: Overheat, Short Circuit, Contagion, Synapse Burnout, Cripple Movement, Weapon Glitch, Sonic Shock, Detonate Grenade This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Biotech Sigma cyberdeck
ThingDef.description: A Biotech Sigma cyberdeck. A compact and stable cyberdeck favored by entry-level netrunners. Optimized for stealth operations and minimal RAM usage, but lacking raw power. Installed quickhacks: Overheat, Short Circuit, Contagion, Synapse Burnout, Reboot Optics, Cripple Movement, Weapon Glitch, Detonate Grenade This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Raven Microcyber cyberdeck
ThingDef.description: A Raven Microcyber cyberdeck. A lightweight, affordable cyberdeck built for reliability and speed over potency. Well-suited to crowd control and supporting hacks. Installed quickhacks: Overheat, Short Circuit, Contagion (2 charges), Cripple Movement, Weapon Glitch, Request Backup, Sonic Shock This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Tetratronic Rippler cyberdeck
ThingDef.description: A Tetratronic Rippler cyberdeck. Designed for combat netrunners, the Rippler emphasizes raw power and crowd control. Well-suited for chaotic battlefield manipulation. Installed quickhacks: Overheat, Short Circuit, Reboot Optics, Weapon Glitch, Cyberpsychosis (2 charges), Detonate Grenade (2 charges) This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Netwatch Netdriver cyberdeck
ThingDef.description: A Netwatch Netdriver cyberdeck. A true "jack of all trades", the Netdriver features extremely quick RAM recovery and emphasizes enhanced system control with stealth and utility hacks while also analyzing targets for vulnerabilities. Installed quickhacks: Overheat, Short Circuit, Contagion, Synapse Burnout, Bait, Memory Wipe, Sonic Shock, System Collapse This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Militech Canto cyberdeck
ThingDef.description: A Militech Canto cyberdeck. The bleeding edge of cyberdeck evolution, the Canto Mk.6 taps into forbidden Blackwall archotech routines. Power comes at a cost The AI engram contained within may occasionally intrude into the host's mind, causing them to behave erratically or even go berserk. Use with caution. Installed quickhacks: Short Circuit, Request Backup, Blackwall Gateway (2 charges) Unlike other cyberdecks, this one is not susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Militech berserk
ThingDef.description: A Militech berserk. The only official berserk implant from Militech available on the market, but an exceptionally fine one at that. Its genius lies in being nanopowered, making it highly suited for regenerative purposes. When active, it puts the user into a primal rage state and renders them invulnerable to physical damage while increasing their own speed and damage dealt, at the cost of forgetting how to handle ranged weapons. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Zetatech berserk
ThingDef.description: A Zetatech berserk. Thanks to its revolutionary nanodermal impact-absorption systems, Zetatech's berserk implant is designed to make its users into lean, mean killing machines that are also hard to kill, themselves. Also features enhanced jump reflexes. When active, it puts the user into a primal rage state and renders them highly resistant to physical damage while increasing their own attack speed, at the cost of forgetting how to handle ranged weapons. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: BioDyne berserk
ThingDef.description: A BioDyne berserk. The berserk model from BioDyne is an affordable and versatile implant for those who want quick and easy results, but don't expect miracles. It does what it says on the box. When active, it puts the user into a primal rage state and renders them highly resistant to physical damage while increasing their own attack speed and damage, at the cost of forgetting how to handle ranged weapons. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Moore Tech berserk
ThingDef.description: A Moore Tech berserk. A classic implant, one of the more popular "Berserk" model made by Moore Technologies. Tested and proven in high-stakes combat. When active, it puts the user into a primal rage state and renders them highly resistant to physical damage at the cost of forgetting how to handle ranged weapons. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Militech "Apogee" sandevistan
ThingDef.description: A Militech "Apogee" sandevistan. The pinnacle of perception and reaction time enhancement. When active, time appears to be slowed down by 85% for the user, while they are not slowed. From an outside perspective, they move fast enough to disappear. This type of boost is very taxing to the user's mind and body, forcing them to eat and rest more often the more they use it. This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs while active. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis. *Note: This implant's ability has a very short duration, and may not be useful with automatic weapons.

ThingDef.label: Militech "Falcon" sandevistan
ThingDef.description: A Militech "Falcon" sandevistan. Military-grade perception and reaction time enhancement. When active, time appears to be slowed down by 70% for the user, while they are not slowed. From an outside perspective, they appear to move at astonishing speed. This type of boost is very taxing to the user's mind and body, forcing them to eat and rest more often the more they use it. This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs while active. It also makes the user *much* more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: QianT "Warp Dancer" sandevistan
ThingDef.description: A QianT "Warp Dancer" sandevistan. This unique unit is more focused on defense rather than offense. When active, time appears to be slowed down by 20% for the user, while they are not slowed. From an outside perspective, they appear to move significantly faster. This type of boost is very taxing to the user's mind and body, forcing them to eat and rest more often the more they use it. This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs while active. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Dynalar sandevistan
ThingDef.description: A Dynalar sandevistan. Civilian-grade perception and reaction time enhancement. When active, time appears to be slowed down by 50% for the user, while they are not slowed. From an outside perspective, they appear to move at incredible speed. This type of boost is very taxing to the user's mind and body, forcing them to eat and rest more often the more they use it. This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs while active. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.

ThingDef.label: Zetatech sandevistan
ThingDef.description: A Zetatech sandevistan. Civilian-grade perception and reaction time enhancement with enhanced jump reflexes. When active, time appears to be slowed down by 30% for the user, while they are not slowed. From an outside perspective, they appear to move at great speed. This type of boost is very taxing to the user's mind and body, forcing them to eat and rest more often the more they use it. This makes the user susceptible to cyberware malfunction from EMPs while active. It also makes the user more prone to psychosis.
